question:
A company has several on-premises Internet Small Computer Systems Interface (ISCSI) network storage servers. The company wants to reduce the number of these servers by moving to the AWS Cloud. A solutions architect must provide low-latency access to frequently used data and reduce the dependency on on-premises servers with a minimal number of infrastructure changes.

Which solution will meet these requirements?

options.A: Deploy an Amazon S3 File Gateway.
options.B: Deploy Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) storage with backups to Amazon S3.
options.C: Deploy an AWS Storage Gateway volume gateway that is configured with stored volumes.
options.D: Deploy an AWS Storage Gateway volume gateway that is configured with cached volumes.

explanation: Volume Gateway with cached volumes provides iSCSI interface compatibility, stores frequently accessed data locally for low-latency access, and stores primary data in S3. This reduces on-premises storage dependency while maintaining low-latency access to hot data.
